member.name: T:TinyFx.Windows.Components.SNTP.LeapIndicator
member.summary: Warns of an impending leap second to be inserted/deleted in the last minute of the current day.

member.name: T:TinyFx.Windows.Components.SNTP.Mode
member.summary: Indicator of the mode of operation. In unicast and anycast modes, the client sets this field to 3 (client) in the request and the server sets it to 4 (server) in the reply. In multicast mode, the server sets this field to 5 (broadcast).

member.name: T:TinyFx.Windows.Components.SNTP.QueryServerCompletedEventArgs
member.summary: Arguments that are passed along with the SNTPClient.QueryServerCompleted event.

member.name: P:TinyFx.Windows.Components.SNTP.QueryServerCompletedEventArgs.Data
member.summary: Gets the data that was returned by the server.

member.name: P:TinyFx.Windows.Components.SNTP.QueryServerCompletedEventArgs.ErrorData
member.summary: Gets data relating to any error that occurred.

member.name: P:TinyFx.Windows.Components.SNTP.QueryServerCompletedEventArgs.LocalDateTimeUpdated
member.summary: Gets whether the local date and time was updated.

member.name: P:TinyFx.Windows.Components.SNTP.QueryServerCompletedEventArgs.Succeeded
member.summary: Gets whether the server query completed successfully. NB: It is possible that other errors occurred (not related to the querying of the server) after the query, so ErrorData should still be examined regardless of the value of this property.

member.name: F:TinyFx.Windows.Components.SNTP.ReferenceIdentifier.LOCL
member.summary: Uncalibrated local clock used as a primary reference for a subnet without external means of synchronization.

member.name: F:TinyFx.Windows.Components.SNTP.ReferenceIdentifier.PPS
member.summary: Atomic clock or other pulse-per-second source individually calibrated to national standards.

member.name: T:TinyFx.Windows.Components.SNTP.SNTPData
member.summary: A class that represents a SNTP packet. See http://www.faqs.org/rfcs/rfc2030.html for full details of protocol.

member.name: F:TinyFx.Windows.Components.SNTP.SNTPData.MaximumLength
member.summary: The maximum number of bytes in a SNTP packet.

member.name: F:TinyFx.Windows.Components.SNTP.SNTPData.MinimumLength
member.summary: The minimum number of bytes in a SNTP packet.

member.name: F:TinyFx.Windows.Components.SNTP.SNTPData.TicksPerSecond
member.summary: Represents the number of ticks in 1 second.

member.name: P:TinyFx.Windows.Components.SNTP.SNTPData.DestinationDateTime
member.summary: Gets the DateTime (UTC) when the data arrived from the server.

member.name: P:TinyFx.Windows.Components.SNTP.SNTPData.LeapIndicator
member.summary: Gets a warning of an impending leap second to be inserted/deleted in the last minute of the current day.

member.name: P:TinyFx.Windows.Components.SNTP.SNTPData.LeapIndicatorText
member.summary: Gets a textual representation of the LeapIndicator property.

member.name: P:TinyFx.Windows.Components.SNTP.SNTPData.Length
member.summary: Gets the number of bytes in the packet.

member.name: P:TinyFx.Windows.Components.SNTP.SNTPData.LocalClockOffset
member.summary: Gets the difference in seconds between the local time and the time retrieved from the server.

member.name: P:TinyFx.Windows.Components.SNTP.SNTPData.Mode
member.summary: Gets the operating mode of whatever last altered the packet.

member.name: P:TinyFx.Windows.Components.SNTP.SNTPData.ModeText
member.summary: Gets a textual representation of the Mode property.

member.name: P:TinyFx.Windows.Components.SNTP.SNTPData.OriginateDateTime
member.summary: Gets the DateTime (UTC) at which the request departed the client for the server.

member.name: P:TinyFx.Windows.Components.SNTP.SNTPData.PollInterval
member.summary: Gets the maximum interval between successive messages, in seconds.

member.name: P:TinyFx.Windows.Components.SNTP.SNTPData.Precision
member.summary: Gets the precision of the clock, in seconds.

member.name: P:TinyFx.Windows.Components.SNTP.SNTPData.ReceiveDateTime
member.summary: Gets the DateTime (UTC) at which the request arrived at the server.

member.name: P:TinyFx.Windows.Components.SNTP.SNTPData.ReferenceDateTime
member.summary: Gets the DateTime (UTC) at which the clock was last set or corrected.

member.name: P:TinyFx.Windows.Components.SNTP.SNTPData.ReferenceIdentifier
member.summary: Gets the identifier of the reference source.

member.name: P:TinyFx.Windows.Components.SNTP.SNTPData.RootDelay
member.summary: Gets the total delay to the primary reference source, in seconds.

member.name: P:TinyFx.Windows.Components.SNTP.SNTPData.RootDispersion
member.summary: Gets the nominal error relative to the primary reference source, in seconds.

member.name: P:TinyFx.Windows.Components.SNTP.SNTPData.RoundTripDelay
member.summary: Gets the total roundtrip delay, in seconds.

member.name: P:TinyFx.Windows.Components.SNTP.SNTPData.Stratum
member.summary: Gets the stratum level of the clock.

member.name: P:TinyFx.Windows.Components.SNTP.SNTPData.StratumText
member.summary: Gets a textual representation of the Stratum property.

member.name: P:TinyFx.Windows.Components.SNTP.SNTPData.TransmitDateTime
member.summary: Gets the DateTime (UTC) at which the reply departed the server for the client.

member.name: P:TinyFx.Windows.Components.SNTP.SNTPData.VersionNumberText
member.summary: Gets a textual representation of the VersionNumber property.

member.summary: Converts a DateTime into a byte array and stores it starting at the position specifed.
member.param: The index in the data at which to start.

member.name: M:TinyFx.Windows.Components.SNTP.SNTPData.SecondsStampToSeconds(System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts a 32bit seconds (16 integer part, 16 fractional part) into a double that represents the value in seconds.
member.param: The index in the data at which to start.
member.returns: A double that represents the value in seconds

member.name: M:TinyFx.Windows.Components.SNTP.SNTPData.TimestampToDateTime(System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts a byte array starting at the position specified into a DateTime.
member.param: The index in the data at which to start.
member.returns: A DateTime converted from a byte array starting at the position specified.

member.summary: Creates a new instance of WebBrowserExtendedNavigatingEventArgs
member.param: Pointer to the automation object of the browser

member.name: T:TinyFx.Windows.WebBrowsers.UrlContext
member.summary: Flags used by INewWindowManager::EvaluateNewWindow. These values are taken into account in the decision of whether to display a pop-up window.

member.name: F:TinyFx.Windows.WebBrowsers.UrlContext.Unloading
member.summary: The page is unloading. This flag is set in response to the onbeforeunload and onunload events. Some pages load pop-up windows when you leave them rather than when you enter. This flag is used to identify those situations.

member.name: F:TinyFx.Windows.WebBrowsers.UrlContext.UserInited
member.summary: The call to INewWindowManager::EvaluateNewWindow is the result of a user-initiated action (a mouse click or key press). Use this flag in conjunction with the NWMF_FIRST_USERINITED flag to determine whether the call is a direct or indirect result of the user-initiated action.

member.name: F:TinyFx.Windows.WebBrowsers.UrlContext.UserFirstInited
member.summary: When NWMF_USERINITED is present, this flag indicates that the call to INewWindowManager::EvaluateNewWindow is the first query that results from this user-initiated action. Always use this flag in conjunction with NWMF_USERINITED.

member.name: F:TinyFx.Windows.WebBrowsers.UrlContext.OverrideKey
member.summary: The override key (ALT) was pressed. The override key is used to bypass the pop-up manager梐llowing all pop-up windows to display梐nd must be held down at the time that INewWindowManager::EvaluateNewWindow is called.

member.name: F:TinyFx.Windows.WebBrowsers.UrlContext.ShowHelp
member.summary: The new window attempting to load is the result of a call to the showHelp method. Help is sometimes displayed in a separate window, and this flag is valuable in those cases.

member.name: F:TinyFx.Windows.WebBrowsers.UrlContext.HtmlDialog
member.summary: The new window is a dialog box that displays HTML content.

member.name: F:TinyFx.Windows.WebBrowsers.UrlContext.FromProxy
member.summary: Indicates that the EvaluateNewWindow method is being called through a marshalled Component Object Model (COM) proxy from another thread. In this situation, the method should make a decision and return immediately without performing blocking operations such as showing modal user interface (UI). Lengthy operations will cause the calling thread to appear unresponsive.

member.summary: Clean up any resources being used.
member.param: true if managed resources should be disposed; otherwise, false.
